Note:
Formerly included under 1174; see Peterson (1980)
XPeterson, Clifford. “John Harding and Geoffrey of Monmouth: Two Unrecorded Poems and a Manuscript.” Notes and Queries n.s. 27 [225] (1980): 202-4 for argument for separation from it.
_description: A prophecy of Merlin — eight lines

OxfAllS33.First Lines:
Cadwalladyre sall Owan callAnd Walys sall busk þaim forto
                    ryse…
OxfAllS33.Last Lines:
…And Bretons chullys þaim als a ballAnd setts to
                    þaim ouer sary assyse
OxfAllS33.Editions:
Peterson,  Clifford. 
             “John Harding and Geoffrey of Monmouth: Two Unrecorded Poems and a
                Manuscript.” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 27 [225] (1980): 202-4: 203.
